abstract.p: New York Yankees, who lost lucrative date at gate in wake of rainout with Baltimore Orioles, announce plans for those ticket-holders (S)

block.p: The Yankees, who lost a lucrative date at the gate in the wake of Tuesday night's rainout, announced plans yesterday for those ticket-holders who lost out as well.

Fans with rain checks from the postponed game against the Orioles can exchange them for any available seats to today's twilight-night doubleheader with Baltimore at Yankee Stadium, which begins at 4:05 P.M., or for any of the Yankees' remaining six home games -- four with Boston this weekend and two with Milwaukee next Tuesday and Wednesday.
The Yankees, who lost a lucrative date at the gate in the wake of Tuesday night's rainout, announced plans yesterday for those ticket-holders who lost out as well.

Fans with rain checks from the postponed game against the Orioles can exchange them for any available seats to today's twilight-night doubleheader with Baltimore at Yankee Stadium, which begins at 4:05 P.M., or for any of the Yankees' remaining six home games -- four with Boston this weekend and two with Milwaukee next Tuesday and Wednesday.

In addition, each fan from Tuesday night's rainout will receive for each rain check a complimentary reserved ticket to his choice of the games with the Brewers next week, the final two of the regular season at the Stadium.
The Yankees cautioned fans seeking to use rain checks tonight that they probably would not get the identical seat they had on Tuesday but could expect a comparable one.
